result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Brian A. Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian A. Mason is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian A. Mason was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Brian A. Mason was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes: See file for complete list of conditions.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall pay restitution to the Sportz Page Bar & Grill in the amount of $827.50 jointly and severally with Paul C. Owens.  Brian Mason paid the Lafayette County District Attorney office on 8/22/17 $500.00 and notified the Clerk of Court on 9/14/17 of this payment.
Defendant shall pay court costs in the amount of $243.00.

Defendant shall not have any contact of any kind with Paul C. Owens.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not enter the Sprotz Page Bar & Grill, or the premises located at 205 East Milwaukee Street, Argyle, WI.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

Case called at 3:41 PM.
Defendant Brian A. Mason in court with attorney Jeremy Christopher Evans.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Evans files plea and waiver of rights form with the court.
Defendant enters a plea of "GUILTY" to Counts  1, 2 & 3
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights, court also questions attorney Evans re: his clients plea and waiver.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
Court finds plea and waiver is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY' to Counts 1, 2 & 3.
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties, attorney Evans concurs with the state's request.
Defendant makes statement to the court.
The court grants motion of the parties Dismissing Counts 4 7 5.
Count 1 D/P Agreement for a period of 4 year.
Counts 2 & 3 orders probation for a period of 3 years concurrent with any other sentence.
